sentences.english: This must be the dawn of wizard hipsters.
sentences.chinese: 这一定是巫师嬉皮士的黎明。

sentences.english: Kingston talks like one of these old hippies herself.
sentences.chinese: 汤亭亭说话的样子好像自己就是那些嬉皮士的一员。

sentences.english: They were dressed up in hippie clothing.
sentences.chinese: 他们全都穿起了嬉皮装。

sentences.english: In this paper, the first chapter primarily analyzes the historical background of the hippy movement.
sentences.chinese: 论文第一章主要分析嬉皮士运动发生的历史背景。

sentences.english: Unschoolers are hippies, eat granola and sprouts, and wear sandals.
sentences.chinese: 非学校教育者是嬉皮士，吃麦片和新鲜蔬菜，穿拖鞋。

sentences.english: They think I’m a bit of a hippie.
sentences.chinese: 他们认为我有一点嬉皮。

sentences.english: “Suit” was the chosen insult of hippies to describe a dull establishment man.
sentences.chinese: 西服曾被嬉皮士戏称为乏味的人的衣着标志。

sentences.english: Female hippies wore flowers in their hair.
sentences.chinese: 女性嬉皮还在她们头上带花。

sentences.english: After the quarrel, Xipixiaolian talent is the true feelings again.
sentences.chinese: 吵完架后又嬉皮笑脸重归于好的人才是真感情。

sentences.english: He does not befriend the players in his dugout.
sentences.chinese: 在选手休息区他从不对选手嬉皮笑脸。

sentences.english: Most hippies protested the Vietnam War and believed in the power of love.
sentences.chinese: 大部分的嬉皮都反越战，并且相信爱的力量。

sentences.english: And I’ve been called a hippie.
There was a kind of social revolution. There were many hippies.
sentences.chinese: 有一个社会运动，出现很多嬉皮士。

sentences.english: Charles Zhang is practically the personification of hip, 21st-century China.
sentences.chinese: 事实上张朝阳是21世纪中国嬉皮的化身。

definition: to return to old ways (a Confucian aspiration)/to turn back the clock/neoclassical school during Tang and Song associated with classical writing 古文/retro (fashion style based on nostalgia, esp. for 1960s)
young person who adopts an artistic or intellectual style/abbr. for 文藝青年|文艺青年
